discoverType.title: Discover Type
discoverType.description: Defines how task discovery will be performed. Use None to skip the discovery. Use HTTP Request to make a REST call to discover tasks. Use Item List to enumerate items for collect to retrieve. Use JSON Response to manually define discover tasks as a JSON array of objects. Each entry returned by the discover operation will result in a collect task.

discovery.errorMessage: Please choose one of the discovery options.

discoverUrl.title: Discover URL
discoverUrl.description: Expression to derive URL to use for the Discover operation (can be a constant).

value.description: JavaScript expression to compute the header value (can be a constant).

discoverDataField.title: Discover Data Field
discoverDataField.description: Path to field in the response object which contains discover results (e.g.: level1.name), leave blank if the result is an array.

manualDiscoverResult.title: Discover result
manualDiscoverResult.description: Allows hard-coding the Discover result. Must be a JSON object. Works with the Discover Data field.

discoverDataField.title: Discover data field
discoverDataField.description: Within the response JSON, name of the field or array element to pull results from. Leave blank if the result is an array of values. Sample entry: items, json: { items: [{id: 'first'},{id: 'second'}] }

itemList.title: Discover items
itemList.description: Comma-separated list of items to return from the Discover task. Each item returned will generate a collect task, and can be referenced using `${id}` in the collect URL, headers, or parameters.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of items to return from discovery.

authenticateCollect.title: Authenticate health check
authenticateCollect.description: Enable to make auth health check call.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: Authentication method for Discover and Collect REST calls. You can specify API Key–based authentication by adding the appropriate Collect headers.

timeout.title: Request Timeout (secs)
timeout.description: HTTP request inactivity timeout, use 0 to disable

rejectUnauthorized.title: Reject unauthorized certificates
rejectUnauthorized.description: Whether to reject certificates that cannot be verified against a valid CA (e.g., self-signed certificates).

safeHeaders.title: Safe headers
safeHeaders.description: List of headers that are safe to log in plain text.

type.title: Retry type
type.description: The algorithm to use when performing HTTP retries

interval.title: Wait (ms)
interval.description: Time interval between retries. Maximum allowed value is 20,000 ms (1/3 minute).

limit.title: Max retries
limit.description: The maximum number of times to retry a failed HTTP request

codes.title: Retry HTTP codes
codes.description: List of HTTP codes that trigger a retry. Leave empty to use the default list of 429 and 503.

enableHeader.title: Honor Retry-After header
enableHeader.description: Honor any Retry-After header that specifies a delay (in seconds) or a timestamp after which to retry the request. The delay is limited to 20 seconds, even if the Retry-After header specifies a longer delay. When disabled, all Retry-After headers are ignored.

interval.title: Initial retry interval (ms)
interval.description: Time interval between failed request and first retry (kickoff). Maximum allowed value is 20,000 ms (1/3 minute).

limit.title: Max retries
limit.description: The maximum number of times to retry a failed HTTP request

multiplier.title: Backoff multiplier
multiplier.description: Base for exponential backoff, e.g., base 2 means that retries will occur after 2, then 4, then 8 seconds, and so on
